I take vyvanse and I was actually asking because I wanted to know the flouride and bromide levels in the pills

I was on 20mg (then 40mg) lexapro for a year which I suspect made me self harm and attempt suicide multiple times due to the drug induced emotional numbness and apathy. 

Originally, I was  just a severely depressed, hormonal teenager with social anxiety. I never really was suicidal or self harmed before taking lexapro. It totally turned me into a violent, apathetic monster with Akathisia and fucked up serotonin receptors.

I tapered off from May-August 2019 and have been self harm free since August with minimal suicidal ideation. While I was tapering off I was in one of the worst depressive episodes of my life but it was so worth it. 

I finally am back the way I was pre-lexapro. Turns out all I needed was heavy DBT/CBT, Jesus and coping skills on how to deal with abusive parents. Although I still have depressive episodes and anxiety, I feel significantly better and am 100% convinced lexapro made everything worse. Slow healing.
This is legendary idc what anyone says.
